:::{#person-profile}
True Furrh is a PhD student working primarily in the [SSPEED Center](https://www.sspeed.rice.edu/).
True is interested in the intersection of urban and natural hydrology, statistical analysis of extreme weather events, and coastal geomorphological processes.
In particular, his research focuses on vegetative infiltration and the role native prairie grasses play in the hydrologic cycle.
True is also interested in statistical methods to predict tropical storm and hurricane frequency in the Gulf of Mexico.
:::
